ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In Transport] This protocol consists of a series of XML elements that are embedded inside of a command request or command response, as specified in [MS-ASCMD].

[In Transport] The XML markup that constitutes the request body or the response body that is transmitted between the client and the server uses Wireless Application Protocol (WAP) Binary XML (WBXML), as specified in [MS-ASWBXML].
[In Message Syntax] The XML schema for the Calendar namespace is described in section 6.
[In Message Syntax] The markup that is used by this protocol[MS-ASCAL] MUST be well-formed XML, as specified in [XML].
[In Namespaces] This specification[MS-ASCAL] defines and references various XML namespaces using the mechanisms specified in [XMLNS].

[In Namespaces] Although this specification[MS-ASCAL] associates a specific XML namespace prefix for each XML namespace that is used, the choice of any particular XML namespace prefix is implementation-specific and not significant for interoperability.
[In Namespaces] [Prefix is] (none)[and Namespace URI is] Calendar.
[In Namespaces] [Prefix is] airsyncbase[and Namespace URI is] AirSyncBase[and reference is] [MS-ASAIRS].
[In Namespaces] [Prefix is ] airsync[and Namespace URI is] AirSync [and reference is] [MS-ASCMD] section 2.2.2.19.
[In Namespaces] [Prefix is] itemoperations[and Namespace URI is] ItemOperations[and reference is:] [MS-ASCMD] section 2.2.2.8.
[In Namespaces] [Prefix is:] search[and Namespace URI is:] Search[and reference is:] [MS-ASCMD] section 2.2.2.14.
[In Namespaces] [Prefix is:] xs[and Namespace URI is:] http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema[and reference is:] [XMLSCHEMA1].
[In Elements] Elements of the Calendar class are defined in two namespaces: Calendar and AirSyncBase.
[In Elements] All Calendar class elements are specified in this document[MS-ASCAL].
[In Elements] However, elements defined in the AirSyncBase namespace are further specified in [MS-ASAIRS].

[In Elements] The following elements[Timezone,AllDayEvent,airsyncbase:Body,BusyStatus,OraganizerName,OrganizerEmail,DtStamp,EndTime,Location,Reminder,Sensitivity,Subject,StartTime,UID,MeetingStatus,Attendees,Categories,Recurrence,Exceptions,ResponseRequested,AppointmentReplyTime,ResponseType,DisallowNewTimeProposal,airsyncbase:NativeBodyType,OnlineMeetingConfLink,OnlineMeetingExternalLink] are top-level elements of the Calendar class.

[In Elements] [Except where otherwise specified in the following sections, each top-level element of the Calendar class is used in ActiveSync command requests and responses as follows:] As an optional child element of the itemoperations:Schema element ([MS-ASCMD] section 2.2.3.145) in ItemOperations command requests ([MS-ASCMD] section 2.2.2.8)

[In Elements][Except where otherwise specified in the following sections, each top-level element of the Calendar class is used in ActiveSync command requests and responses as follows:] As an optional child element of the itemoperations:Properties element ([MS-ASCMD] section 2.2.3.128.1) in ItemOperations command responses ([MS-ASCMD] section 2.2.2.8)

[In Elements] [Except where otherwise specified in the following sections, each top-level element of the Calendar class is used in ActiveSync command requests and responses as follows:]As an optional child element of the search:Properties element ([MS-ASCMD] section 2.2.3.128.2) in Search command responses ([MS-ASCMD] section 2.2.2.14)

[In Elements] [Except where otherwise specified in the following sections, each top-level element of the Calendar class is used in ActiveSync command requests and responses as follows:]As an optional child element of the airsync:ApplicationData element ([MS-ASCMD] section 2.2.3.11) in Sync command requests ([MS-ASCMD] section 2.2.2.19)

[In Elements] [Except where otherwise specified in the following sections, each top-level element of the Calendar class is used in ActiveSync command requests and responses as follows:]As an optional child element of the airsync:ApplicationData element ([MS-ASCMD] section 2.2.3.11) in Sync command responses ([MS-ASCMD] section 2.2.2.19)

[In Elements] The following table summarizes the set of common XML schema elements[Timezone,AllDayEvent,airsyncbase:Body,BusyStatus,OrganizerName,OrganizerEmail,DtStamp,EndTime,Location,Reminder,Sensitivity,Subject,StartTime,UID,MeetingStatus,Attendees,Attendee,Email,Name,AttendeeStatus,AttendeeType,Categories,Category,Recurrence,Type,Occurrences,Interval,WeekOfMonth,DayOfWeek,MonthOfYear,Until,DayOfMonth,CalendarType,IsLeapMonth,FirstDayOfWeek,Exceptions,Exception,DeletedExceptionStartTime,ResponseRequested,AppointmentReplyTime,ResponseTypeDisallowNewTimeProposal,airsyncbase:NativeBodyType,OnlineMeetingConfLink,OnlineMeetingExternalLink] that are defined or used by this specification[MS-ASCAL].
[In Elements] XML schema elements that are specific to a particular operation are specified further in sections 3.1.5.1, 3.1.5.2, 3.1.5.3, 3.2.5.1, 3.2.5.2, and 3.2.5.3.
[In Elements] [The element Timezone's description is:] The time zone of the calendar item.
[In Elements] [The element AllDayEvent's description is:]Specifies whether the event represented by the calendar item or exception item runs for the entire day.
[In Elements] [The element airsyncbase:Body's description is ]The body text of the calendar item.
[In Elements] [The element BusyStatus's description is:]Specifies whether the recipient (1) is busy at the specified time.
[In Elements] [The element OrganizerName's description is:]The name of the user who created the calendar item.
[In Elements] [The element OrganizerName's description is:]The e-mail address of the user who created the calendar item.
[In Elements] [The element DtStamp's description is:]The date and time at which the calendar item was created or modified, or the date and time at which the exception item was created.
[In Elements] [The element EndTime 's description is:]The end time of the calendar item or exception item.
[In Elements] [The element Location's description is:]The place where the event specified by the calendar item or exception item occurs.
[In Elements] [The element Reminder's description is:]The number of minutes before the calendar item's start time to display a reminder notice.
[In Elements] [The element Sensitivity's description is:] The recommended privacy policy for this calendar item or exception item.
[In Elements] [The element Subject's description is:] The subject of the calendar item or exception item.
[In Elements] [The element StartTime's description is:]The start time of the calendar item or exception item.
[In Elements] [The element UID's description is:] A unique, 300 digit hexadecimal ID generated by the client when the calendar item is created.

[In Elements] [The element MeetingStatus' description is :] Indicates whether the event is a meeting or an appointment, whether the event is canceled or active, and whether the user was the organizer.
[In Elements] [The element Attendees' description is:]The collection of attendees for the calendar item.
[In Elements] [The element Attendee 's description is:] An attendee who is invited to the event.
[In Elements] [The element Email's description is:] The e-mail address of the attendee.
[In Elements] [The element Name's description is:] The name of the attendee.
[In Elements] [The element AttendeeStatus's description is: ]The attendee's acceptance status.
[In Elements] [The element AttendeeType is]Specifies whether the attendee is required, optional, or a resource.
[In Elements] [The element Categories' description is:] The collection of categories for the calendar item or exception item.
[In Elements] [The element Category 's description is:] A category that is assigned to the calendar item or exception item.
[In Elements] [The element Recurrence's description is:] The recurrence information for the calendar item.
[In Elements] [The element Type's description is:] The type of the recurrence.
[In Elements] [The element Occurrences' description is:]The number of recurrences.
[In Elements] [The element Interval's description is:]The interval between recurrences.
[In Elements] [The element WeekOfMonth's description is:]The week of the month for the recurrence.
[In Elements] [The element DayOfWeek 's description is:]The day of the week for the recurrence.
[In Elements] [The element MonthOfYear's description is:]The month of the year for the recurrence.
[In Elements] [The element Until 's description is:]The end date and time of the recurrence.
[In Elements] [The element DayOfMonth 's description is:]The day of the month of the recurrence.
[In Elements] [The element CalendarType's description is:]The calendar system used by the recurrence.
[In Elements] [The element IsLeapMonth's description is:] Specifies whether the recurrence of the appointment is to take place on the embolismic (leap) month.
[In Elements] [The element FirstDayOfWeek'description is:] Specifies which day is considered the first day of the calendar week for the recurrence.
[In Elements] [The element Exceptions 's description is:] A collection of exceptions to the recurrence pattern of the calendar item.
[In Elements] [The element Exception's description is:] An exception to the calendar item's recurrence pattern.
[In Elements] [The element Deleted 's description is:] Specifies whether the exception has been deleted.
[In Elements] [The element ExceptionStartTime's description is:] The start time of the original recurring meeting.
[In Elements] [The element ResponseRequested is] Specifies whether a response to the meeting request is required.
[In Elements] [The element AppointmentReplyTime's description is:]The date and time that the user responded to the meeting request or to the meeting exception request.
[In Elements] [The element ResponseType's description is:]The type of response made by the user to a meeting request.
[In Elements] [The element DisallowNewTimeProposal's description is:] Specifies whether recipients of the meeting request can propose a new time for the meeting.
[In Elements] [The element airsyncbase:NativeBodyType's description is:] Specifies how the body text of the calendar item is stored on the server.
[In Elements] [The element OnlineMeetingConfLink's description is:] A Globally Routable User Agent URI (GRUU) ([MS-SIPRE]) for an online meeting.
[In Elements] [The element OnlineMeetingExternalLink's description is:] A Uniform Resource Locator (URL) for an online meeting.
[In AllDayEvent] As a top-level element of the Calendar class, the AllDayEvent element is an optional element.
[In AllDayEvent] The AllDayEvent element specifies whether the event represented by the calendar item runs for the entire day.
[In AllDayEvent] It[AllDayEvent] is used in ActiveSync command requests and responses as specified in section 2.2.2.
[In AllDayEvent] [AllDayEvent] As an optional child element of the Exception element (section 2.2.2.19).
[In AllDayEvent] [AllDayEvent] specifies whether the event represented by the exception runs for the entire day.
[In AllDayEvent] A command request has a maximum of one AllDayEvent child element per Exception element.
[In AllDayEvent] A command response has a maximum of one AllDayEvent child element per Exception element.

[In AllDayEvent] If the AllDayEvent element is not specified as a child element of an Exception element, the value of the AllDayEvent element is assumed to be the same as the value of the top-level AllDayEvent element.
[In AllDayEvent] The AllDayEvent element is defined as an element in the Calendar namespace.
[In AllDayEvent] The value of this element is an unsignedByte data type, as specified in [MS-ASDTYPE] section 2.7.
[In AllDayEvent] The value of the AllDayEvent element MUST be one of the values[0,1] listed in the following table.
[In AllDayEvent][The value 0 means AllDayEvent] Is not an all day event.
[In AllDayEvent][The value 1 means AllDayEvent] Is an all day event.
[In AllDayEvent] An item marked as an all day event is understood to begin on midnight of the current day and to end on midnight of the next day.

[In AllDayEvent] If a request includes the AllDayEvent element as well as the StartTime element, as specified in section 2.2.2.40, and the EndTime element, as specified in section 2.2.2.18, and the StartTime and EndTime elements are not midnight to midnight values, then the server ignores the AllDayEvent element, does not include the AllDayEvent element in the response, and creates the event given the values of the StartTime element and EndTime element.
[In AppointmentReplyTime] As a top-level element of the Calendar class, the AppointmentReplyTime<1> element is an optional element.
[In AppointmentReplyTime] As a top-level element of the Calendar class, the AppointmentReplyTime<1> element specifies the date and time that the current user responded to the meeting request.
[In AppointmentReplyTime] [AppointmentReplyTime element] As an optional child element of the Exception element (section 2.2.2.19).
[In AppointmentReplyTime] The AppointmentReplyTime element specifies the date and time that the user responded to the meeting request exception.
[In AppointmentReplyTime] The AppointmentReplyTime element is defined as an element in the Calendar namespace.
[In AppointmentReplyTime] The value of this element is a string data type, represented as a Compact DateTime ([MS-ASDTYPE] section 2.6.5).
[In AppointmentReplyTime] A command request MUST NOT include the AppointmentReplyTime element, either as a top-level element or as a child element of the Exception element.
[In AppointmentReplyTime] A command response has a maximum of one top-level AppointmentReplyTime element per response
[In AppointmentReplyTime][A command response has] a maximum of one AppointmentReplyTime child element per Exception element.
[In AppointmentReplyTime] The top-level AppointmentReplyTime element can be ghosted.
[In AppointmentReplyTime] For details about the use of ghosted properties, see [MS-ASCMD] section 2.2.3.164.
[In Attendee] The Attendee element is an optional container ([MS-ASDTYPE] section 2.2) element.
[In Attendee] The Attendee element specifies an attendee who is invited to the event.
[In Attendee] It[Attendee] is a child element of the Attendees element (section 2.2.2.4).
[In Attendee] It[Attendee] is defined as an element in the Calendar namespace.
[In Attendee] [The Attendee element can have the following child elements:] Email (section 2.2.2.17): One instance of this element is required.
[In Attendee][The Attendee element can have the following child elements:] Name (section 2.2.2.28): One instance of this element is required.
[In Attendee][The Attendee element can have the following child elements:] AttendeeStatus (section 2.2.2.5): This element is optional.
[In Attendee][The Attendee element can have the following child elements:] AttendeeType (section 2.2.2.6): This element is optional.
[In Attendees] As a top-level element of the Calendar class, the Attendees element is an optional container ([MS-ASDTYPE] section 2.2) element.
[In Attendees] As a top-level element of the Calendar class, the Attendees element specifies the collection of attendees for the calendar item.
[In Attendees] It[ Attendees] is used in ActiveSync command requests and responses as specified in section 2.2.2.
[In Attendees] The Attendees element is an optional child element of the Exception element (section 2.2.2.19).
[In Attendees] The Attendees element specifies the collection of attendees for the calendar item exception.<2>
[In Attendees] A command request has a maximum of one Attendees child element per Exception element.
[In Attendees] A command response has a maximum of one Attendees child element per Exception element.

[In Attendees] If the Attendees element is not specified as a child element of the Exception element, the attendees for the calendar item exception are assumed to be the same as the value of the top-level Attendees element.
[In Attendees] The Attendees element is defined as an element in the Calendar namespace.
[In Attendees] [The Attendees element can have the following child element:]Attendee (section 2.2.2.3): This element is optional.
[In Attendees] The top-level Attendees element can be ghosted.
[In Attendees] For details about the use of ghosted properties, see [MS-ASCMD] section 2.2.3.164.
[In AttendeeStatus] The AttendeeStatus element is an optional child element of the Attendee element (section 2.2.2.3).
[In AttendeeStatus] The AttendeeStatus element specifies the attendee's acceptance status.
[In AttendeeStatus] It[AttendeeStatus] is defined as an element in the Calendar namespace.
[In AttendeeStatus] A command request has a maximum of one AttendeeStatus element per Attendee element.
[In AttendeeStatus] A command response has a maximum of one AttendeeStatus element per Attendee element.
[In AttendeeStatus] The value of this element is an unsignedByte data type, as specified in [MS-ASDTYPE] section 2.7.
[In AttendeeStatus] The value of the AttendeeStatus element MUST be one of the values[0,2,3,4,5] listed in the following table.
[In AttendeeStatus] [The value is] 0 [meaning] Response unknown.
[In AttendeeStatus] [The value is] 2 [meaning]Tentative.
[In AttendeeStatus] [The value is] 3 [meaning]Accept.
[In AttendeeStatus] [The value is] 4 [meaning] Decline.
[In AttendeeStatus] [The value is] 5 [meaning] Not responded.
[In AttendeeType] The AttendeeType element is an optional child element of the Attendee element (section 2.2.2.3).
[In AttendeeType] The AttendeeType element specifies whether the attendee is required, optional, or a resource.
[In AttendeeType] It[AttendeeType] is defined as an element in the Calendar namespace.
[In AttendeeType] A command response has a maximum of one AttendeeType element per Attendee element.
[In AttendeeType] The value of this element is an unsignedByte data type, as specified in [MS-ASDTYPE] section 2.7.
[In AttendeeType] The value of the AttendeeType element MUST be one of the values[1,2,3] specified in the following table.
[In AttendeeType] [The value is] 1 [meaning] Required.
[In AttendeeType] [The value is] 2 [meaning] Optional.
[In AttendeeType] [The value is] 3 [meaning] Resource.
[In Body] As a top-level element of the Calendar class, the airsyncbase:Body element is an optional container ([MS-ASDTYPE] section 2.2) element.
[In Body] As a top-level element of the Calendar class, the airsyncbase:Body element specifies the body text of the calendar item.
[In Body] It[Body] is used in ActiveSync command requests and responses as specified in section 2.2.2.
[In Body] As an optional child element of the Exception element (section 2.2.2.19), the airsyncbase:Body element is a container ([MS-ASDTYPE] section 2.2) element.
[In Body] The airsyncbase:Body element specifies the body text of the calendar item exception.
[In Body] A command request has a maximum of one airsyncbase:Body child element per Exception element.
[In Body] A command response has a maximum of one airsyncbase:Body child element per Exception element.
[In Body] The top-level airsyncbase:Body element can be ghosted.
[In Body] For details about the use of ghosted properties, see [MS-ASCMD] section 2.2.3.164.
[In Body] The airsyncbase:Body element is defined as an element in the AirSyncBase namespace and is further specified in [MS-ASAIRS] section 2.2.2.4.
[In BusyStatus] As a top-level element of the Calendar class, the BusyStatus element is an optional element.
[In BusyStatus] As a top-level element of the Calendar class, the BusyStatus element specifies whether the recipient is busy at the time of the meeting.
[In BusyStatus] It[BusyStatus] is used in ActiveSync command requests and responses as specified in section 2.2.2.
[In BusyStatus] The BusyStatus element is an optional child element of the Exception element (section 2.2.2.19).
[In BusyStatus] The BusyStatus element specifies the busy status of the meeting organizer.
[In BusyStatus] A command request has a maximum of one BusyStatus child element per Exception element.
[In BusyStatus] A command response has a maximum of one BusyStatus child element per Exception element.

[In BusyStatus] If the BusyStatus element is not specified as a child element of an Exception element, the value of the BusyStatus element is assumed to be the same as the value of the top-level BusyStatus element.
[In BusyStatus] The BusyStatus element is defined as an element in the Calendar namespace.
[In BusyStatus] The value of this element is an unsignedByte data type, as specified in [MS-ASDTYPE] section 2.7.
[In BusyStatus] The value of the BusyStatus element MUST be one of the values[0,1,2,3] listed in the following table.
[In BusyStatus] [The value is] 0 [meaning] Free.
[In BusyStatus] [The value is] 1 [meaning] Tentative.
[In BusyStatus] [The value is] 2 [meaning] Busy.
[In BusyStatus] [The value is] 3 [meaning] OutofOffice.
[In CalendarType] The CalendarType element<3> is a child element of the Recurrence element (section 2.2.2.35) that specifies the calendar system used by the recurrence.
[In CalendarType] It[CalendarType] is defined as an element in the Calendar namespace.
[In CalendarType] A command request has a maximum of one CalendarType child element per Recurrence element when the Type element (section 2.2.2.43) value is 2, 3, 5, or 6.
[In CalendarType] A command response has a minimum of one CalendarType child element per Recurrence element when the Type element value is 2.
[In CalendarType] A command response has a minimum of one CalendarType child element per Recurrence element when the Type element value is 3.
[In CalendarType] A command response has a minimum of one CalendarType child element per Recurrence element when the Type element value is 5.
[In CalendarType] A command response has a minimum of one CalendarType child element per Recurrence element when the Type element value is 6.

[In CalendarType] [A command response has a minimum of one CalendarType child element per Recurrence element when the Type element value is 2, 3, 5, or 6.]Otherwise, this element is optional in command responses.
[In CalendarType] The value of this element is an unsignedByte data type, as specified in [MS-ASDTYPE] section 2.7.
[In CalendarType] The value of the CalendarType element MUST be one of the values[0~23] listed in the following table.
[In CalendarType] [The value] 0 [means] Default
[In CalendarType] [The value] 1 [means]Gregorian
[In CalendarType] [The value] 2 [means]Gregorian (United States)
[In CalendarType] [The value] 3 [means]Japanese Emperor Era
[In CalendarType] [The value] 4 [means]Taiwan
[In CalendarType] [The value] 5 [means]Korean Tangun Era
[In CalendarType] [The value] 6 [means]Hijri (Arabic Lunar)
[In CalendarType] [The value] 7 [means]Thai
[In CalendarType] [The value] 8 [means]Hebrew Lunar
[In CalendarType] [The value] 9 [means]Gregorian (Middle East French)
[In CalendarType] [The value] 10 [means]Gregorian (Arabic)
[In CalendarType] [The value] 11 [means]Gregorian (Transliterated English)
[In CalendarType] [The value]12 [means]Gregorian (Transliterated French)
[In CalendarType] [The value] 13 [means]Reserved.
[In CalendarType] [The value 13]MUST NOT be used.
[In CalendarType] [The value]14[means]Japanese Lunar
[In CalendarType] [The value] 15[means]Chinese Lunar
[In CalendarType] [The value] 16 [means]Saka Era.
[In CalendarType] [The value 16 is]Reserved.
[In CalendarType] [The value 16]MUST NOT be used.
[In CalendarType] [The value] 17 [means]Chinese Lunar (Eto).
[In CalendarType][The value 17 is]Reserved.
[In CalendarType] [The value 17]MUST NOT be used.
[In CalendarType] [The value 18 means]Korean Lunar (Eto).
[In CalendarType] [The value 18 is]Reserved.
[In CalendarType][The value 18] MUST NOT be used.
[In CalendarType] [The value 19 means]Japanese Rokuyou Lunar.
[In CalendarType] [The value 19 is]Reserved.
[In CalendarType] [The value 19]MUST NOT be used.
[In CalendarType] [The value ]20[means] Korean Lunar
[In CalendarType] [The value 21 is]Reserved.
[In CalendarType] [The value 21]MUST NOT be used.
[In CalendarType] [The value 22 is]Reserved.
[In CalendarType] [The value 22]MUST NOT be used.
[In CalendarType] [The value 23 means]Um al-Qura.
[In CalendarType] [The value 23 is]Reserved.
[In CalendarType] [The value 23] MUST NOT be used.
[In CalendarType] The server MAY return a value of 0 (Default) when a client specifies a value of 1 (Gregorian).
[In Categories] As a top-level element of the Calendar class, the Categories element is an optional container ([MS-ASDTYPE] section 2.2) element.
[In Categories] The Categories element specifies a collection of categories assigned to the calendar item.
[In Categories] It[Categories] is used in ActiveSync command requests and responses as specified in section 2.2.2.
[In Categories] As a child element of the Exception element (section 2.2.2.19), the Categories element is an optional container ([MS-ASDTYPE] section 2.2) element.
[In Categories] As a child element of the Exception element (section 2.2.2.19), the Categories element specifies the categories for the exception item.
[In Categories] A command request has a maximum of one Categories child element per Exception element.
[In Categories] A command response has a maximum of one Categories child element per Exception element.
[In Categories] The Categories element is defined as an element in the Calendar namespace.
[In Categories] [The Categories element can have the following child element:]Category (section 2.2.2.11)
[In Category] The Category element is an optional child element of the Categories element (section 2.2.2.10).
[In Category] The Category element specifies a category that is assigned to the calendar item.
[In Category] The Category element specifies a category that is assigned to the exception item.
[In Category] It[Category] is defined as an element in the Calendar namespace.
[In Category] The value of this element is a string data type, as specified in [MS-ASDTYPE] section 2.6.
[In Category] A command request SHOULD include no more than 300 Category child elements per Categories element.
[In Category] A command response SHOULD include no more than 300 Category child elements per Categories element.
[In DayOfMonth] The DayOfMonth element is a child element of the Recurrence element (section 2.2.2.35).
[In DayOfMonth] The DayOfMonth element specifies the day of the month for the recurrence.
[In DayOfMonth] It[DayOfMonth] is defined as an element in the Calendar namespace.
[In DayOfMonth] A command request has a minimum of one DayOfMonth child element per Recurrence element when the value of the Type element (section 2.2.2.43) is either 2 or 5.
[In DayOfMonth] A command response has a minimum of one DayOfMonth child element per Recurrence element when the value of the Type element (section 2.2.2.43) is 2[or 5].
[In DayOfMonth] A command response has a minimum of one DayOfMonth child element per Recurrence element when the value of the Type element (section 2.2.2.43) is [2 or] 5.
[In DayOfMonth] A command request has a maximum of one DayOfMonth child element per Recurrence element.
[In DayOfMonth] A command response has a maximum of one DayOfMonth child element per Recurrence element.
[In DayOfMonth] The value of the DayOfMonth element is an unsignedByte data type, as specified in [MS-ASDTYPE] section 2.7.
[In DayOfMonth] The value of this element[DayOfMonth] MUST be between 1 and 31.
[In DayOfMonth] The DayOfMonth element MUST be included in requests when the Type element value is either 2 or 5.
[In DayOfMonth] The DayOfMonth element MUST be included in responses when the Type element value is 2[or 5].
[In DayOfMonth] The DayOfMonth element MUST be included in responses when the Type element value is [2 or] 5.
[In DayOfMonth] The DayOfMonth element MUST NOT be included in requests [or responses] when the Type element value is zero (0), 1, 3, or 6 .
[In DayOfMonth] The DayOfMonth element MUST NOT be included in responses when the Type element value is zero (0).
[In DayOfMonth] The DayOfMonth element MUST NOT be included in responses when the Type element value is 1.
[In DayOfMonth] The DayOfMonth element MUST NOT be included in responses when the Type element value is 3.
[In DayOfMonth] The DayOfMonth element MUST NOT be included in responses when the Type element value is 6.
[In DayOfWeek] The DayOfWeek element is a child element of the Recurrence element (section 2.2.2.35) that specifies the day of the week for the recurrence.
[In DayOfWeek] It[DayOfWeek] is defined as an element in the Calendar namespace.
[In DayOfWeek] A command request has a maximum of one DayOfWeek child element per Recurrence element.
[In DayOfWeek] A command response has a maximum of one DayOfWeek child element per Recurrence element.
[In DayOfWeek] The value of this element is an unsignedShort data type, as specified in [XMLSCHEMA2/2].

[In DayOfWeek] The value of the DayOfWeek element MUST be one of the values[1,2,4,8,16,32,62,64,65,127] listed in the following table [or the sum of more than one of the values listed in the following table (in which case this task recurs on more than one day)].

[In DayOfWeek] The value of the DayOfWeek element MUST be [one of the values[1,2,4,8,16,32,62,64,65,127] listed in the following table, or] the sum of more than one of the values listed in the following table (in which case this task recurs on more than one day).
[In DayOfWeek] The value of the DayOfWeek element MUST NOT be greater than 127.
[In DayOfWeek][The value] 1 [means] Sunday.
[In DayOfWeek][The value] 2 [means]Monday
[In DayOfWeek][The value] 4 [means]Tuesday
[In DayOfWeek][The value] 8 [means] Wednesday.
[In DayOfWeek][The value] 16 [means]Thursday.
[In DayOfWeek][The value] 32 [means] Friday.
[In DayOfWeek][The value] 62 [means] Weekdays.
[In DayOfWeek][The value] 64 [means] Saturday.
[In DayOfWeek][The value] 65 [means] Weekend days.
[In DayOfWeek][The value 127 means]The last day of the month.
[In DayOfWeek] [The value 127] Used as a special value in monthly or yearly recurrences.
[In DayOfWeek] The DayOfWeek element MUST only be included in requests when the Type element (section 2.2.2.43) value is 0 (zero), 1, 3, or 6.
[In DayOfWeek] The DayOfWeek element MUST only be included in responses when the Type element (section 2.2.2.43) value is 0 (zero).

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In DayOfWeek] The DayOfWeek element MUST only be included in responses when the Type element (section 2.2.2.43) value is 3.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In DayOfWeek] The DayOfWeek element MUST only be included in responses when the Type element (section 2.2.2.43) value is 6.

[In DayOfWeek] The DayOfWeek element MUST be included in responses when the Type element (section 2.2.2.43) value is 1.
[In DayOfWeek] The DayOfWeek element MUST be included in responses when the Type element (section 2.2.2.43) value is 3.
